thread.title: Through the years: Playboy's most famous nude celebrities
thread.title_full: Through the years: Playboy's most famous nude celebrities | Fox News

author: FoxNews.com
title: Through the years: Playboy's most famous nude celebrities
text:
Published October 13, 2015 FoxNews.com Facebook 0 Twitter 0 livefyre Email Print
The news that Playboy won’t be featuring nude women in its pages anymore rocked the publishing world on Tuesday.
The magazine that launched in 1953 with nude photos of blonde bombshell Marilyn Monroe became famous for featuring nude photos of scores of famous women, including Kim Basinger, Ursula Andress, La Toya Jackson, and Brooke Burke.
But a few celebrities made extra huge splashes when they appeared in their birthday suits.
Marilyn Monroe
Related Image Expand / Contract
The magazine’s first issue featured photos Monroe had taken for a nude calendar in 1949 when she was just embarking on her acting career.
Bo Derek
Related Image Expand / Contract Bo Derek in 2000.
Derek posed nude for Playboy in 1980 following her debut in the hit movie “10.” When her career took a dip, she posed again in 1985.
Suzanne Somers
Related Image Expand / Contract
Somers posed for Playboy in 1970 but the photos weren’t published until 1980, after she was famous for her role in “Three’s Company,” and after she had denied on the “Tonight Show” ever having posed for the magazine. Apparently she had a change of heart because she posed again in 1984.
Pam Anderson
Related Image Expand / Contract Farrah gets her star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame February 23, 1995.
Anderson first appeared in Playboy in 1989 after becoming famous for her role on “Baywatch.” She has since appeared on more covers than any other woman in Playboy history.
Farrah Fawcett
Related Image Expand / Contract
Fawcett first posed for Playboy in 1995, but she made her biggest splash when she did it again at the age of 50 in 1997, this time covered in paint and rolling around on canvases making something she called ‘body art.’
Lindsay Lohan
The troubled actress posed nude in a Marilyn Monroe-themed shoot in 2012. The shoot was seen as a boost to her flagging career, and a boost to Playboy’s flagging sales.
Kate Moss
Suerpmodels don't usually pose for Playboy, so when the petite Kate Moss took her clothes off for the magazine in 2014, many saw it as a sign Playboy was trying something new. Little did the know that it was just the beginning.
